definitions.definition: ( countable ) One who engages in sexual intercourse , particularly:

subdefinitions.definition: ( now historical ) One who is paid for sex .
( obsolete ) A boy or younger man who engages in sexual intercourse by an older man as a (usually passive ) homosexual partner. [from 1698]
( chiefly US , LGBTQ ) A passive or effeminate homosexual man.
( US , LGBTQ , slang ) A boy who accompanies a hobo , especially as used for sex . [from 1893]
( US , LGBTQ , derogatory , chiefly African-American Vernacular ) A male homosexual . [from 1933]
( US , LGBTQ , prison slang ) A man forced or coerced into a homosexual relationship , especially in prison . [from 1946]
examples: Because he was so weak, Vinny soon became Tony's punk .

definitions.definition: ( countable , US , slang ) A worthless person, particularly: [from 1904]

subdefinitions.definition: ( humorous , rare ) Any person, especially a male comrade . [from 1904]
( derogatory ) A petty criminal , especially a juvenile delinquent . [from 1908]
( circus slang ) A young , untrained animal or worker . [from 1926]

definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) A group of associated musical , artistic and social movements emerging out of the counterculture in the 1970s:

subdefinitions.definition: ( music ) Ellipsis of punk rock , a genre known for short , loud , energetic songs with electric guitars and strong drums and shocking or political lyrics .
( fashion ) The fashion style associated with punk rock, typically involving leather , metal studs and pins , distressed clothing and confrontational slogans .
The larger nonconformist social movement associated with punk rock and its fans .
( science fiction , usually in compounds ) Any of the -punk genres , typically involving anachronistic technology and its social impact : dieselpunk , solarpunk , steampunk etc.

definitions.definition: ( countable ) A follower of any of these movements, including:

subdefinitions.definition: Ellipsis of punk rocker , a musician known for playing punk rock or a fan of the genre .
examples: My girlfriend is a punk and she plays the drums.

subdefinitions.definition: A person who designs or dresses in punk fashion style.
A member of the punk social movement; usually anarchist and socially non-conformist although potentially either left-wing or right-wing .
( science fiction , usually in compounds ) A fan of a -punk genre of fiction, or a person who dresses in a style associated with it.

main_definition: ( countable ) One who engages in sexual intercourse , particularly:
secondary_definitions: ( countable , US , slang ) A worthless person, particularly: [from 1904]
( uncountable ) A group of associated musical , artistic and social movements emerging out of the counterculture in the 1970s:
( countable ) A follower of any of these movements, including:

definitions.definition: Any material used as tinder for lighting fires, such as agaric , dried wood , or touchwood , but especially wood altered by certain fungi.
A utensil for lighting wicks or fuses (such as those of fireworks) resembling stick incense.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Any material used as tinder for lighting fires, such as agaric , dried wood , or touchwood , but especially wood altered by certain fungi.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A utensil for lighting wicks or fuses (such as those of fireworks) resembling stick incense.
